page.title: 10HEADCORN PRIMARY SCHOOL (1)
page.content: The village Primary School is housed in 2 distinct sets of buildings. One,the{Old Block,is built of ragstone and has has small windows and high ceilings. It dates from 1873. Here 3 classes work. The other set is the{New {Block}and dates from the early 1970's,when it was built to accomodate the rapidly expanding numbers of school age children in Headcorn. Here 5 classes work. A separate{Infants' {Dept.}consists of 3 classes and 80 children taught by 3 women. They are housed in the New Block. The{Junior classes, 5 of them,with between 28 and 35 pupils are not grouped exactly by age. They are taught by 3 women and 2 men. There is a Headmaster,a full-time Secretary,a Caretaker who lives on site,several Kitchen Staff who provide excellent midday meals and some women playground supervisors.
